issue.title: Feedbacks for Note10
issue.body:
For the following code
```
string = "../../../blog/20160730-mediawiki-wiki-knowledge-management-system/"
s = string.split('/blog')
#s
s1 = s[-1]
#s1
s2='{0}{1}'.format('http://initiumlab.com',s1)
#s2
```
What we expected was ```"http://initiumlab.com/blog/20160730-mediawiki-wiki-knowledge-management-system/"```
If we use the code listed above, what we actually got would be ```'http://initiumlab.com/20160730-mediawiki-wiki-knowledge-management-system/'```

"/blog/" should be also added @ChicoXYC

comment.body: @hupili I guess this is the reason. Because in previous example, i use `str` as a assignment. I've changed it into other name.

issue.title: I want to enrich my data.
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting


I want to enrich my data. It seems that I have to click every single webpage in the first column "work name" to find more information to support my story.

https://archiveofourown.org/media/Movies/fandoms

Beside, as using this method I mentioned，I have trouble in finding kudos. 

================
现有的思路：
写两个爬虫，把两个爬虫都设置成函数

第一个爬虫收集https://archiveofourown.org/media/Movies/fandoms页面下的 书名  超链接 文章数
eg：
![37771542968747_ pic](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42727192/48939740-3c20ba00-ef50-11e8-9707-462de95139a3.jpg)

按照文章数量从高到低选出前100栏，生成第一个csv 1

第二个爬虫：提取出超链接这一栏，通过try函数，抓取这100个页面里第一页（20篇）的 words , hits

（第二个爬虫的csv有对应问题，因为一个原作名字要对应很多个文章名字）

comment.body: @Rita0719 https://github.com/ChicoXYC/exercise/blob/master/student-cases/archiveofourown_movie.ipynb I've crawled all the single film urls here, you can use a for loop for scraping other information. Because I don't quite understand what you are going to scrape in the detailed pages. If you have further questions, please let me know.

issue.title: How to loop in different format {}
issue.body: # Troubleshooting ## Describe your environment * Operating system: mac * Python version: 3.7 * Hardware: macbook * Internet access: http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/27/nbs.D110000renmrb_01.htm * Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]: Y * Which chapter of book?: ## Describe your question I am scraping articles from people's daily I want to 1. find different articles, 2. turn pages (4 pages) 3. change the dates at the same time. But how can I do it with .format() if the number for each purposes is different. And one of them is not a fixed number, since there might be 4/5/6/7 articles articles) . ## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue Example: ```python def gettext(url): import requests r=requests.get(url) r.encoding = 'utf-8' import bs4 mypage = bs4.BeautifulSoup(r.text) text = mypage.find(attrs={'class': 'text_c'}).text.strip() return text for i in range (1,9): url = "http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2008-10/27/nw.D110000renmrb_20081027_{}-01.htm".format(i) onepage = gettext(url) print(onepage) ```

comment.body:
@lullabymia Nonetype means that it doesn't find the text you want, mostly because there might be no text. Following is the debugging process.

1. please first format all the URLs you want, append into a list.
2. find elements in a single page. If works, then for loop all the URL lists to get more.
3. For handling none type error when scraping, please refer the following method, and you can checkout the error cases later.

```python
    try:
        #your scraping codes here
    except Exception as e:
        print(e)
        print('Error on page %s' % i)
```

issue.title: Problems about wordcloud
issue.body:
Here is my code:
```
from wordcloud import WordCloud
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
text = open('keywords.csv','r').read()
wordcloud = WordCloud().generate(text)
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.axis('off')
plt.show()

wordcloud.to_file('Osaka.jpg')
```
The value Error is : We need at least 1 word to plot a word cloud, got 0.
Thank you very much!

comment.body: @Shinonomee first, you csv has some error when written, please check out the scraping process. second, the value error indicates that you need to check out the `text` whether there is `text` or not. according to my test, the issue here is `UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode...` change the encoding method will work. ```python from wordcloud import WordCloud import matplotlib.pyplot as plt text = open('keywords.csv','r',encoding = "ISO-8859-1").read() wordcloud = WordCloud().generate(text) plt.imshow(wordcloud) plt.axis('off') plt.show() ```

issue.title: CH09 Data Visualization Libraries Feedbacks
issue.body:
## matplotlib
-  ```plt.rcParams['font.sans-serif']=['SimHei']```
Some computers like mine may find no 'SimHei' font and raise a UserWarning. We can recommend the readers to try fonts like ```'Arial Unicode MS'``` if they encounter my problem. To see which fonts can be used here, I found a way from the Internet. It means the fonts with larger bytes are more likely to be Chinese fonts:
```bash
from matplotlib.font_manager import fontManager
import os
[font.name for font in fontManager.ttflist if os.path.exists(font.fname) and os.stat(font.fname).st_size>1e7]
#output: ['AppleMyungjo', 'AppleGothic', 'Arial Unicode MS']
```
## plotly
- plotly now need registration to be used. we can remind the readers to log in [here](https://plot.ly/Auth/login/#/) and regenerate an api_key after registration. We also need to add a line:
```
plotly.tools.set_credentials_file(username='XXX(you own username)', api_key='xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx(you own api_key)')
```
## pyecharts
- ```!pip install pyecharts```
When install pyecharts, someone may encounter this like me:
```error: command 'clang' failed with exit status 1```
Then I googled and learned it's because of my lack of ```xcode command tools```. The problem can be solved with operating ```!xcode-select --install``` in Jupyter. We can add this reminder.

comment.body: @FLYSTEPHEN About `plotly`. This is because I use the plot online method, which requires an account. I just updated the plot.offline method, you can try without creating an account. https://github.com/hupili/python-for-data-and-media-communication-gitbook/blob/master/notes-week-09.md#plotly

issue.title: CH09 feedbacks
issue.body:
```
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
data = [1, 5, 2, 3, 2]
df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=['value'])
df
plt.bar(df.index, df.value) #pass x label value and y label value
```
The first line should be ```import pandas as pd``` because pyplot has already been imported before. However, pandas has not been imported.

Also, I think ```plt.show()```should be added to make sure the figure will be displayed

comment.body:
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41979788/48525462-3a575680-e8bf-11e8-886d-e029f3e0e71d.png)
> 
> Do we need an account to use this function? @ChicoXYC

@SerenaQYHuang This is because I use the plot online method, which requires an account. I just updated the `plot.offline` method, you can try without creating an account. https://github.com/hupili/python-for-data-and-media-communication-gitbook/blob/master/notes-week-09.md#plotly

Some computers like mine may find no 'SimHei' font and raise a UserWarning. We can recommend the readers to try fonts like ```'Arial Unicode MS'``` if they encounter my problem. To see which fonts can be used here, I found a way from the Internet. It means the fonts with larger bytes are more likely to be Chinese fonts:
```bash
from matplotlib.font_manager import fontManager
import os

```
## plotly
- plotly now need registration to be used. we can remind the readers to log in [here](https://plot.ly/Auth/login/#/) and regenerate an api_key after registration. We also need to add a line:

plotly.tools.set_credentials_file(username='XXX(you own username)', api_key='xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx(you own api_key)')

Then I googled and learned it's because of my lack of ```xcode command tools```. The problem can be solved with operating ```!xcode-select --install``` in Jupyter. We can add this reminder.

issue.title: Assignment 1-Data of different kinds pop up all at once in rows
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting
Different types of data (names, types, numbers of reviews, etc., as the website crawled is TripAdvisor) came up in one piece of text and in rows, stopping further attempts in ranking in rows with different columns showing different specs in cvs file. Also, irrelevant texts that should be in other parts of the site were included. Should be because of wrong coding/filtering in the previous steps but couldn't define which parts to be included.

## Describe your environment

* Operating system: MacOS 10.11.6
* Python version: 3.6.3
* Hardware: MBPR 13" 2015
* Internet access: Wi-Fi
* Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]:Y
* Which chapter of book?:Assignment

<!-- Texts appear in angle brackets like this are comments and will not show in your issue body. They are here to help you fill in this form. Feel free to remove those comments. You can also remove other texts that is irrelevant to your issue -->

## Describe your question
Where to look for the exact tags needed? How to ensure data came in different section to be written in columns instead of rows?

Example: I get IOError when running my script to load files.

<!-- Upload screenshot if it helps. Simply drag and drop the image in this editing window. -->

## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue

Example:

```
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
url='https://en.tripadvisor.com.hk/Restaurants-g294217-Hong_Kong.html'
import requests
r=requests.get(url)
soup=BeautifulSoup(r.text)
for text in soup.find_all('a'):
    print(text.get_text())
```

<!-- If you have big project hard to summarise, please upload it onto GitHub and put link here -->

## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue
Googled similar attempts to exclude the irrelevant urls, hrefs in getting the texts of it. But cannot help excluding the other texts not needed.

Example:

### Have you Google/ Stackover flow anything?

### Do they solve or partially solve your question?

### What is the closest answer you can find?
